title: Mussels in turmeric and ginger broth

ingredients.content: 10 sprigs fresh coriander, roots and stalks for broth, leaves reserved for garnishing
1 fresh long red chilli, deseeded if preferred, plus extra, thinly sliced for garnishing
1 - 2 tsp Chicken stock paste, to taste (see Tips)
1000 g fresh mussels, scrubbed and debearded

preparations.content: Place spring onions/shallots, garlic, Kaffir lime leaves, lemongrass, oil, ginger, palm sugar, coriander roots and stalks, chilli and turmeric into mixing bowl and chop <b>6 sec/speed 8<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté <b>3 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.
Add coconut milk, water and stock paste. Place Varoma into position and weigh mussels into it. Secure Varoma lid and steam <b>7 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.
Carefully stir mussels to ensure even cooking, secure Varoma lid and steam for a further <b>7 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.
Divide mussels between serving bowls and discard any that have not opened during cooking.
Add fish sauce and lime juice to mixing bowl and mix <b>6 sec//speed 2<b>. Pour broth over mussels and garnish with reserved fresh coriander leaves and sliced chillies to serve.

hintsAndTricks: You can replace the ground turmeric with a 1-2 cm piece fresh, peeled turmeric, if desired.
Please refer to The Basic Cookbook or the Everyday Cookbook for the Chicken stock paste recipe.
